page.title: 06EDUCATION. (2.)
page.content:
{St. Michael's College,}a very well known Preparatory Choir School of high repute in the musical world, founded by Sis Frederick Ousley in 1856, sadly closed on July 14th.1985. The number of pupils required to make the school financially viable was at least 80 and at closure had fallen to 47 boys and girls in the Preparatory school and 18 in the Pre-Preparatory Department. Despite tremendous efforts by the Warden,the Revd. A.F.Walters, his Staff and pupils parents to reverse the trend the numbers had fallen consistently over the previous five years and the Governors had no alternative but to close the school.
